DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare two different weight management delivery method , social medium versus traditional care model .
DOC.brief_title: Remote Delivery Weight Management Phone Social Media
DOC.detailed_description: Obesity major public health issue 68 % US population either overweight obese . Weight loss weight loss maintenance difficult . Traditionally , successful weight loss program weekly behaviorally-based clinic utilize combination calorie restriction physical activity . Traditional `` face face '' weekly meeting may feasible everyone . An alternative provide weight loss weight maintenance create KUMC researcher use weekly group phone conference call . While method produce equal weight loss few burden participant compare traditional `` face face '' format , weight regain maintenance still high . This study investigate new delivery method ( social medium platform `` Facebook '' ) compare group phone conference call . In social medium platform participant able socialize participant group comment post participant post message . Social medium deliver program potential cost-effective approach reach large group individual . Participants eligible decide study take part study related activity 6 month .
DOC.criteria: Body mass index ( BMI ) 30 45 kg/m^2 Have access computer , smart phone , tablet Give inform consent participate Unable participate moderate intensity PA ( i.e. , walk ) Participation weight loss physical activity program previous 6 mo . Greater 3 , 30min bout plan exercise/week Not weight stable ( Â±4.6 kg ) 3 mo . prior intake Unwilling randomize 1 2 study group Report pregnant previous 6 mos. , currently lactate , planned pregnancy follow 6 mo . Serious medical risk cancer , recent cardiac event ( i.e . heart attack , stroke , angioplasty ) determine individual 's PCP via clearance participate investigation Current use antipsychotic untreated depression Adherence specialize diet regimen , i.e. , multiple food allergy , vegetarian , macrobiotic Binge eat disorder assess Binge Eating Scale Living household another study participant
